column2: The Treasure Fleet has finally returned to the Middle Kingdom, and the many soldiers and officials aboard have started to disembark. Judging by the reports that are spreading, the voyage went about as well as could have been hoped for, and it is clear to everyone that the [treasure_fleet_original_sender.GetSonDaughterCap] of Heaven, [treasure_fleet_original_sender.GetBestName], truly made a wise decision to dispatch it.\nThe recent display of the might of the Middle Kingdom will surely cause even the fiercest detractors to become more convinced that the current imperial dynasty truly possesses the Mandate of Heaven.

Judging by the reports that are spreading, the voyage went about as well as could have been hoped for, and it is clear to everyone that the [treasure_fleet_original_sender.GetSonDaughterCap] of Heaven, [treasure_fleet_original_sender.GetBestName], truly made a wise decision to dispatch it.\nThe recent display of the might of the Middle Kingdom will surely cause even the fiercest detractors to become more convinced that the current imperial dynasty truly possesses the Mandate of Heaven.
How unfortunate it did not sink...

The Treasure Fleet has finally returned to the Middle Kingdom, and the many soldiers and officials aboard have started to disembark. Judging by the reports that are spreading, the Treasure Fleet somehow ended up at the legendary Mount Penglai, where a single Peach of Immortality was entrusted to its commander for delivery to the [treasure_fleet_original_sender.GetSonDaughterCap] of Heaven.\nThis highly unexpected outcome will surely cause even the fiercest detractors to become more convinced that the current imperial dynasty truly possesses the Mandate of Heaven.
My reign will truly last ten thousand years!

The Treasure Fleet has finally returned to the Middle Kingdom, and the many soldiers and officials aboard have started to disembark. Judging by the reports that are spreading, the Treasure Fleet somehow ended up at the legendary Mount Penglai. Unfortunately, there apparently were no immortals to be found there, and no Peaches of Immortality.\nThough not the ideal outcome for the [treasure_fleet_sender.GetSonDaughterCap] of Heaven, it is still a good outcome, and surely even the fiercest detractors are now more convinced that the current imperial dynasty truly possesses the Mandate of Heaven.
Perhaps another voyage would be good...

The Treasure Fleet has finally returned to the Middle Kingdom, and the many soldiers and officials aboard have started to disembark. Judging by the reports that are spreading, the Treasure Fleet encountered many strange lands to the east, and many lives were lost there. Rumour has it they were attacked by at least one dragon, that they encountered an island where the water could kill, and that some ships vanished into an unnatural darkness.\nDespite these events, the voyage must be said to have been a success, and the [treasure_fleet_sender.GetSonDaughterCap] of Heaven's imperial dynasty's claim to possesses the Mandate of Heaven is more likely to be believed as a result.

The tattered remnants of the Treasure Fleet have returned to the Middle Kingdom, and the surviving soldiers and officials aboard have started to disembark. They bring with them tales of a nightmarish city in the unexplored east, and of an unnatural being living there, whose very presence was said to drive men insane. Apparently the Treasure Fleet had to fight this being, and many ships and lives were lost in the attempt.\nFew believe the tales that are spreading, and between the tales and the great damage the Treasure Fleet has suffered it is clear that the voyage did not go well. The [treasure_fleet_sender.GetSonDaughterCap] of Heaven's claim to possesses the Mandate of Heaven is less believable as a result.

The Treasure Fleet has finally returned to the Middle Kingdom, and the many soldiers and officials aboard have started to disembark. Reports are spreading that the ships encounted a large island far to the east, upon which a number of massive cities stood. Unfortunately, the island suffered a series of disasters and sank beneath the waves.\nThough there are those that might wish to dismiss these tales, a number of people dressed in strange clothes have returned with the Treasure Fleet, apparently survivours of these disasters.\nDespite having to witness the island sinking beneeath the waves, the Treasure Fleet's voyage seems to have been a success.
A shame the island was lost...

The remnants of the Treasure Fleet has returned to the Middle Kingdom, bringing with it a small number of survivours belonging to the once-glorious expedition. Reports start spreading almost immediately that these survivours claim to have encountered a massive empire far, far to the east, which they refer to as the Burning Emprie.\nThe tales that are spreading are hard to believe, and differ on some points, but they all seem to agree that the Sapa Inca - the ruler of the Burning Empire - turned against the Treasure Fleet and had his warriors seize most of the ships. The survivours claim that his inexhaustable armies will be coming, sooner or later.
